document.heading: Income and Franchise Tax Technical Conformity Act of 1987

history.narrative: Law 6-110, the “Income and Franchise Tax Technical Conformity Act of 1987,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-341, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 11, 1986 and February 25, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 11, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-140 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
